source_sentence: 佛說福力太子因緣經卷第三
translation: Foshuo foulli 太子因緣經卷第三佛說福力太子因緣經經經經,卷第三

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝奉大夫試光祿卿傳
translation: Xitian zhuan jing sanzang朝奉大夫試光祿卿傳

source_sentence: 法大師賜紫沙門臣施護等奉　詔譯
translation: The Master of the Dharma bestowed upon the purple-robed ministers Shihu and others an imperial edict that they should translate it.

source_sentence: 「爾時帝釋天主，見是福力，現生果報，希有瑞相，又知人天悉皆胥悅，
translation: At that time Śakra, lord of the gods, seeing this power of blessedness, gave birth to a fruitful retribution. There was rarely an auspicious sign and he also knew that both humans and gods were delighted.

source_sentence: 心頗異之。
translation: The mind is quite different from it.

source_sentence: 乃謂福力太子言：『太子！
translation: He then said to the prince of merit, 'Prince!

source_sentence: 汝今如是勤修勝行，有何所求？』
translation: Now that you're thus diligently cultivating superior practice, what do you seek?'

source_sentence: 太子白言：『天主！
translation: The prince said, 'O lord of gods!

source_sentence: 我為求證阿耨多羅三藐三菩提果，拯拔一切有情，出生死海，悉令安住究竟涅槃。』
translation: In order to realize the fruit of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, I save all sentient beings from the sea of birth and death and make them all abide in ultimate nirvāṇa.'

source_sentence: 時帝釋天主，知福力太子勤求阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，深心不動，猶若須彌，
translation: At that time Indra, the lord of the gods, knowing that Prince Fu力 was diligently seeking highest, complete enlightenment, remained deeply unmoved like a polar mountain.

source_sentence: 稱可其意，作是讚言：『善哉，善哉！
translation: Praising their intentions, they praised them and said, 'Good, good!'

source_sentence: 大士！
translation: Great man!

source_sentence: 汝有廣大最上願力，必當速證阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。』
translation: You have the vast power of the supreme vow, and you will surely quickly realize unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 如是言已，隱身不現。
translation: After saying this, he hides himself and doesn't show it.

source_sentence: 「復次，於後彼國之王耆年而終，其王未立灌頂太子，於是王之宗族臣佐人民，
translation: “Furthermore, when the king of that country died at the end of his old age, the king had not installed a crown prince to consecrate him. So the clansmen and ministers of the king’s clan assisted the people.

source_sentence: 共會議言：『我等于今當令何人紹灌頂位？』
translation: They all said, 'Who will cause us to present the stage of consecration now?'

source_sentence: 時一人言：『若有福力大名稱者，可宜紹位。』
translation: One person then said, 'If there's a great reputation for the power of merit, it's advisable to create a position.'

source_sentence: 如是言已，眾意悉同，即遣使人周行求訪。
translation: Having said this, they all agreed to send an envoy to travel around in search of the monastery.

source_sentence: 「是時福力太子，當繼王位，善根開發，與諸侍從，出遊園林；
translation: “At that time Prince Fuli, who was about to succeed to the throne and his roots of goodness developing, went out with his attendants on a pleasure excursion into the forest.

source_sentence: 太子行時，道路平坦，觸處皆無荊棘砂礫；
translation: When the prince was on his way the road became level and there were no thorns, thorny rocks, or sand or gravel at all when he touched it.

source_sentence: 於其中路，吉祥相現：細雨散空，旋布其頂；
translation: On the way there, an auspicious sign appeared: fine rain scattering down on the sky and spreading its tops.

source_sentence: 異色飛鳥，順次宛轉；
translation: A bird of different colors flew in an orderly fashion.

source_sentence: 童男童女，發勝妙聲，踊躍奔馳，咸生歡悅；
translation: The boys and girls spoke a sublime voice, leaping and galloping. They all became joyous.

source_sentence: 一切人眾，身毛喜豎，皆得輕安。
translation: All the people, whose hair stood on end and their bodies greeted each other with joy, felt at ease.

source_sentence: 又聞空中悅意之言。
translation: I've also heard the words of joy in the sky.

source_sentence: 太子覩斯事相，即起思念：『此相出現，我當決定紹灌頂位。』
translation: When the prince saw these signs, he thought to himself, 'When these signs appear, I will surely assume the position of consecration.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，進詣園中，受諸福樂。
translation: After he had this thought, he went to the park and received various blessings and happiness.

source_sentence: 其園有一大無憂樹，華開茂盛，太子於彼安然寢寐。
translation: In that park there was a large tree of no sorrow, with abundant flowers blooming in full bloom. The prince slept and slept peacefully among them.

source_sentence: 諸同往者，樂華果故，各於園中，隨處遊賞。
translation: Those who went together enjoyed flowers and fruits, so they each stayed in the park and wandered around to enjoy them.

source_sentence: 又復太子，福威力故，彼有龍王，忽然從地涌出千葉微妙蓮華，其量廣大，
translation: Again, prince, it is due to the power of his meritorious deeds that a dragon king suddenly emerged from the earth like this one thousand leaves of a subtle lotus flower so large and vast in size.

source_sentence: 色香具足，最上可愛。
translation: Form and odor are abundant and most desirable.

source_sentence: 而彼龍王，又以神力徐置太子在蓮華上；
translation: The king of the nāga also, through his supernatural powers, slowly placed the prince on top of the lotus flower.

source_sentence: 爾時太子都無動覺。
translation: At the time, the prince had no movement or awakening at all.

source_sentence: 由是漸過食時，日正中分，餘諸樹影悉皆移動，唯無憂樹影覆太子身，
translation: The shadows of the other trees all moved, but the shadow of the sorrowless tree alone covered the prince’s body.

source_sentence: 如故不動。
translation: It doesn't move as before.

source_sentence: 又彼園中諸餘華樹，皆悉傾向，大無憂樹，吉祥勝相，悅意可觀。
translation: The other flowering trees in the park all tended toward each other, and the great tree of no sorrow was an auspicious and superior sign that delighted people to look at.

source_sentence: 「時福力太子，夢見自身處穢污上，又見自身穢污所染，又見自以舌舐虛空，
translation: Prince Fu力 then dreamt that he saw himself lying on top of the filthy surface of his body, and also saw himself stained by the filthy dirt.

source_sentence: 又見自身蓮華中立，又見自身上起山峯，又見眾人頂禮於己。
translation: He also saw himself standing in the middle of a lotus flower, and he saw himself rising up a mountain peak above him.

source_sentence: 太子寤已，隨應占察如上所夢：『如我夢見自身在於穢污上者，我必應居灌頂王位，
translation: When the prince saw this, he followed the man's instructions and divined what had been dreamt of above, saying, 'Suppose I dreamt that I saw myself on top of a filthy surface, and then I would surely occupy the position of coronated king.

source_sentence: 大富自在，斯為前相。
translation: The possession of great wealth is the former characteristic.

source_sentence: 如我所見穢污染身者，我應處于大師子座。
translation: If I see a body that's polluted by defilement, I should sit on the lion's seat.

source_sentence: 如我所見上起山峯者，我應於一切處常居最上。
translation: If I were to see a mountain peak rising above me, I would always be the highest among all places.

source_sentence: 如我所見眾人頂禮者，我應為彼眾所尊重。
translation: If someone were to bow their heads to me, I would be honored by that group of people.

source_sentence: 如是等事，審占其相，我今決定為灌頂王。』
translation: Such things are judged by their characteristics, and now I'm certain to be the king of consecration.'

source_sentence: 「爾時彼國臣佐，先遣使人周行求訪到彼園中，具見太子次第相續吉祥勝相；
translation: At that time, the ministers and assistants of his country had previously sent envoys traveling in all directions to visit those parks. They saw the prince’s auspicious appearance continuing in an orderly fashion.

source_sentence: 心生驚異，此大福力，有大名稱。
translation: The mind is startled, and this great power of blessedness has a great reputation.

source_sentence: 即時速還，具陳上事。
translation: Immediately, he quickly returned and told the above story.

source_sentence: 時諸臣佐，聞彼言已，皆生歡喜。
translation: When the ministers and assistants heard those words, they all rejoiced.

source_sentence: 即依法儀，悉備所須，行詣園中，授其灌頂，到已見諸吉祥勝相。
translation: He then prepared everything he needed according to the rules of the Dharma, went to the park, gave him a consecration, and when he arrived, he saw the auspicious and superior features.

source_sentence: 「時福力太子，即於微妙大蓮華上，結加趺坐。
translation: The prince of the power of blessedness then sat cross-legged on a subtle, large lotus flower.

source_sentence: 以福力開發故，四大天王奉天莊嚴大師子座，帝釋天主奉天妙蓋及眾寶拂，
translation: Because of the development of their power of blessedness, the four great celestial kings offered heavenly adornments to the lion seat of the Great Master, while Indra the lord of the gods offered heavenly canopies and myriad jeweled whisks.

source_sentence: 忉利諸天奉種種寶嚴飾露幔，散眾寶華如雲而下。
translation: The Trāyastriṃśa gods offered various kinds of jeweled adornments to the dew curtains, scattering jeweled flowers like clouds and descending down.

source_sentence: 四大王天諸天子眾，雨種種寶，奏天微妙可愛音樂，及散妙衣。
translation: The four great kings of the gods and their celestial sons rained various treasures, playing heavenly subtle and pleasing music and spreading exquisite robes.

source_sentence: 國中園林，周遍清淨，一切悉無荊棘砂礫。
translation: The parks and forests of the kingdom are all pure and there are no thorns, thorny trees, or sand or gravel.

source_sentence: 豎立幢幡珠繒交絡，設妙香瓶，散諸異華與天宮等。
translation: He erects banners, streamers, beads, and pearls, sets up marvelous fragrant vases, and spreads strange flowers like heavenly palaces.

source_sentence: 帝釋天主，勅毘首羯磨天子，普於園林，悉令化出四寶所成廣大樓閣，
translation: Indra, the lord of the gods, commanded the deities Vaiśravaṇa and Viśvabhāma to cause all in the parks and forests to emanate vast mansions made of the four precious treasures.

source_sentence: 以備太子隨意受用。
translation: It's to prepare the prince to receive and use it as he wishes.

source_sentence: 時彼臣佐，又觀如是希有勝相，轉復異之，咸各肅恭，虔命太子處師子座，
translation: The ministers and assistants then observed such rare and extraordinary signs, all increasingly distancing themselves from each other. Each of them revered the prince and ordered him to sit cross-legged on a lion seat.

source_sentence: 頂禮尊奉，如其法儀，為授灌頂。
translation: He paid homage to the venerable and consecrated him in accordance with his rituals.

source_sentence: 太子得灌頂已，身出光明，周遍照耀一由旬量，映蔽日光而不顯現。
translation: After the prince had received the consecration, a ray of light emerged from his body that shone brightly all around him for one yojana and reflected the sunlight that obscured it but didn't show up.

source_sentence: 是時眾中，有一類人，見斯光已，咸悉稱言：『此勝光王。』
translation: At the time, there was a certain group of people in the crowd who saw this light and all called out, 'This is King of Supreme Light.'

source_sentence: 一類人言：『此福力王。』
translation: A certain group of people said, 'This is the king of merit and power.'

source_sentence: 「爾時福力王將入王城，帝釋天主等，於其王前，隨依法儀，作供獻已，
translation: “At that time the king of the power of blessedness was about to enter the royal city. Indra, the lord of the gods, and others made offerings before the king in accordance with the proper rituals.

source_sentence: 隱復天宮。
translation: He returned to the heavenly palace in seclusion.

source_sentence: 時福力王，既入城已，善布國政，人民熾盛，安隱豐樂，息諸鬪諍，却除他敵，
translation: The king of the power of blessedness then entered the city and spread his kingdom’s affairs well. The inhabitants were prosperous and peaceful, endowed with abundant happiness. He extinguished all fighting and dispelled any enemies that mighty enemy.

source_sentence: 悉無賊盜、飢饉、疾病，愛護人民，猶如一子。
translation: They all have no thieves, thieves, thieves, hunger, famine, or illness, and they love protect the people like a child.

source_sentence: 華果樹林，悉皆茂盛，時令不愆，稼穡豐阜，雨澤順時，大地受潤。
translation: Flowers and fruit trees all grow luxuriantly and the land is nourished by rain and moistened by plenty of crops and fields.

source_sentence: 復次，其後王之四兄，聞斯異事，咸生驚怪，共會議言：『福力太子，
translation: Furthermore, when the four brothers of the late king heard this strange story, they all wondered and said together in unison, “O Prince Fuli!

source_sentence: 勝過我等，福慧二全，以福力故，為大國王，最上大富，稱可我心，我等今時宜共往彼。』
translation: They're superior to us, and both merit and wisdom are complete; because of the power of their fortune, they're great kings who are the most wealthy and praise our minds, so it's appropriate for us to go there together now.'

source_sentence: 於是四兄，同詣福力王所。
translation: The four brothers then went to the place where King Fuli lived.

source_sentence: 到已即時咸祝之言：『願汝最勝增長壽命。』
translation: Immediately after arriving, they all prayed to him, saying, 'May you most excellently increase your life span.'

source_sentence: 又復讚言：『善哉！
translation: Again, he praised them, saying, 'Good!

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 汝昔要期，今能固立福慧若斯，勝過我等，於他國中，統王大位，皆由汝勝福力所成。
translation: In the past, you were so greatly superior to us in terms of merit and wisdom that you are now able to establish such goodness and wisdom. The sovereignty and powers of other kingdoms are all due to your superior meritorious virtue.

source_sentence: 我等親朋，具悉瞻覩。』
translation: Our relatives and friends, we'll see it all.'

source_sentence: 「時福力王，從師子座歡喜而下，致敬問訊，如應施設高廣之座，命彼諸兄次第而坐。
translation: The king of the power of blessedness then descended from his lion's seat, rejoicing, respectfully greeted him, arranged a high and wide seat as appropriate, and ordered his brothers to sit down in order.

source_sentence: 諸兄即令王復本座。
translation: The brothers then ordered the king to return to his seat.

source_sentence: 眾坐已定，作諸供獻。
translation: The assembly was seated in meditation and offered various offerings.

source_sentence: 如先所論，互談議已，皆生決定歡喜之心。
translation: As we've discussed before, they all become certain and joyous after talking to each other.

source_sentence: 時王起尊重意，各以所奉。
translation: The king then raised his respectful intentions, and each offered what he wanted.

source_sentence: 「『無福者墮地獄中，　　受大苦惱常無間；
translation: Those without virtue will fall into hell, enduring great pain and suffering unremittingly.

source_sentence: 或墮餓鬼或畜生，　　受飢渴苦及負重。
translation: Or they may fall into hungry ghosts or animals, suffering from hunger, thirst, pain, and heavy burdens.

source_sentence: 無福之者壞其身，　　無福為奴重疲極，
translation: Those without virtue break their bodies and those without virtue become slaves, overcome by exhaustion.

source_sentence: 無福墮於聾瘂中，　　無福愚鈍多邪慧。
translation: They'll fall into the deaf and dumb because of lack of virtue, and they'll be ignorant and dull with many mistaken wisdoms.

source_sentence: 無福之者魑魅著，　　無福之者醜形容，
translation: Those without virtue are addicted to debauchery, while those without virtue are ugly and disfigured.

source_sentence: 無福多於下族生，　　無福心亂人所惡，
translation: The absence of virtue is prevalent in the lower classes, and the absence of virtue disturbs people’s bad thoughts.

source_sentence: 無福之者多迷惑，　　無福為他所輕謗，
translation: Those who lack virtue are often confused, and those who lack virtue are despised by others.

source_sentence: 無福之者諸所為，　　雖復勤力不成就。
translation: Those who lack virtue do whatever they want, even though they're diligent and unable to accomplish it.

source_sentence: 無福之者身麤澁，　　悉無威光不可意；
translation: The absence of virtue in those who are unworthy is due to physical ill-will, All without authoritative radiance that cannot be wished.

source_sentence: 無福之人兄所居，　　草木青潤成枯瘁。
translation: Where the unworthy man's brother lives, The grass and trees are green and moistened to become withered.

source_sentence: 無福人所不隨順，　　外境觸害亦復然；
translation: Not to be complied with by those without virtue, So also is the injury caused by touching external objects.

source_sentence: 諸惡鬼神羅剎娑，　　常時侵嬈無福者。
translation: The evil spirits and rākṣasa demons constantly harm those who lack virtue.

source_sentence: 無福者用藥治病，　　返成非藥病增劇；
translation: Those without virtue use medicine to treat illness, Yet turn back to what is not medicine for the increase of illness.

source_sentence: 由無福故受貧窮，　　復為他人所輕慢。
translation: Because of their lack of virtue, they'll be poor and despised by others.

source_sentence: 無福之人生子息，　　其性麤惡眾憎嫌；
translation: Those without virtue are born as children, Their natures crude and hateful, hated by all.

source_sentence: 無福者雖眷屬多，　　常時離散生苦惱。
translation: Even though those without virtue have many followers, suffering and distress arise from separation at all times.

source_sentence: 無福者壞於眼目，　　而復相續諸苦生，
translation: The absence of virtue destroys the eyes and eyes, And continues to give rise to pain.

source_sentence: 多病皆由無福因，　　小生疾病固難差。
translation: Many illnesses are all due to the absence of good causes, and it's certainly difficult to cure illnesses that arise in small ways.

source_sentence: 無福之人多兇惡，　　無福常發麤惡聲；
translation: Those without virtue are often fierce and wicked, And those without virtue always speak in angry voices.

source_sentence: 手指攣拳體不完，　　語言人多不信順。
translation: Their fingers twitch and their fists aren't complete, and many people who speak don't believe in it.

source_sentence: 無福之人諸所有，　　王官水火盜賊銷；
translation: All the property of those without virtue was owned by the royal officials and destroyed by water, fire, and thieves.

source_sentence: 無福唯聞非愛言，　　觸處常生於驚怖。
translation: The only thing that's unworthy is hearing what's not loved, and the place where it's touched always gives rise to fear.

source_sentence: 無福雖居平坦地，　　隨處旋當荊棘生；
translation: Even though they live in a level ground without merit, Wherever they revolve, brambles and thorns will grow.

source_sentence: 設或植種及經商，　　雖常多作無義利。
translation: Even if someone plants seeds and stores, even though they always do a lot of work for no profit.

source_sentence: 無福者於一切時，　　所有財寶皆散壞；
translation: The unworthy, at all times, All their possessions and treasures will perish.

source_sentence: 世間無少顧戀心，　　實不可愛無善利；
translation: The world has no little concern for attachment, Is really unattractive and lacks good benefits.

source_sentence: 諸無福者如是相，　　智者當知皆破壞。
translation: Such are the characteristics of those who lack merit, and it should be known that wise people destroy them all.

source_sentence: 福者所作善護持，　　於一切時無散失。
translation: A virtuous person's actions are well guarded, and there's no dissipation at all times.

source_sentence: 福者所行不懈倦，　　常起堅固勇悍心，
translation: The virtuous one’s deeds are unremitting; He always produces a firm, courageous mind.

source_sentence: 如蓋覆蔭廣無邊，　　復能制除諸惡雨。
translation: Like a canopy that covers and shades boundlessly, It can also remove the rain of evil.

source_sentence: 猶犢隨母常飼乳，　　福者如意善欲同；
translation: It’s like a calf following its mother and always feeding on milk: The blessed one is the same as wishing for what’s good and desirous.

source_sentence: 又如劫樹悅意觀，　　常獲一切所欲果。
translation: It's also like an eon tree that delights in contemplation and always obtains the fruit of all desires.

source_sentence: 福者能具忍辱力，　　及得悅意大吉祥；
translation: The blessed one can be endowed with the power of forbearance And attain joyful great auspiciousness.

source_sentence: 信行深固可依從，　　生生皆具妙色相。
translation: The practice of faith is deep and firm to be relied upon; All sentient beings are endowed with marvelous forms.

source_sentence: 福者廣布大名稱，　　能具多聞及智慧；
translation: The blessed one spreads great fame And is endowed with extensive learning and wisdom.

source_sentence: 見者咸生愛樂心，　　又能獲得聞持念。
translation: Those who see all give rise to a mind of desire and joy, and they can also attain hearing and maintaining mindfulness.

source_sentence: 福者臨終無疾病，　　臨終亦復歡喜生，
translation: The blessed one dies without illness, And at the end of his life is also born with joy.

source_sentence: 極惡境相不現前，　　遠離驚怖及苦惱。
translation: The characteristics of extreme bad objects don't appear, and they're free of fear and suffering.

source_sentence: 福者臨終受天樂，　　天宮樓閣現其前；
translation: The blessed one receives heavenly bliss at the end of his life, With celestial palaces and towers appearing before him.

source_sentence: 忉利諸天夜摩天，　　彼彼天人來引接；
translation: The Trāyastriṃśa gods, the Yama gods, and the other heavenly beings came to receive him.

source_sentence: 兜率天宮諸天子，　　化樂天眾亦復然，
translation: So it is with the celestial beings in the palace of the Tushita heaven and the gods in the Nirmāṇarati heaven.

source_sentence: 他化自在欲界天，　　咸來衛護於福者。
translation: The gods of the desire realm who are free to teach others and come to protect those who are blessed.

source_sentence: 福者猶如大梵王，　　俱胝天眾皆宗奉，
translation: The blessed one is like the great king of Brahmā. All the gods in Kauṇḍinya Heaven revere him.

source_sentence: 於其一千梵界中，　　廣大尊勝而自在。
translation: In the one thousand worlds of Brahma, They are vast and honored, And free.

source_sentence: 福者諸所作皆成，　　復常處於快樂位，
translation: The blessed one’s deeds are all accomplished, And he always remains in the state of bliss.

source_sentence: 一切皆生愛樂心，　　乃至外境無觸害。』
translation: All of them all give rise to a mind of desire and pleasure, up to the point where external objects are not touched or harmed.'

source_sentence: 如是集會過二三日，王為諸兄及彼人眾開發，令知福非福事，說伽陀曰：「是時諸兄及其人眾，
translation: After two or three days of this assembly, the king revealed to his brothers and other members of the assembly what was meritorious and what was not meritorious. He said to Kātyāyana:

source_sentence: 聞伽陀已，於福力王，心皆信伏，極大歡喜。
translation: Having heard the Buddha’s words, they all had faith in King Puṣkarasārin and believed in him. They were overjoyed.

source_sentence: 現世他生，顯明開示，一向悉知，福力最勝。
translation: In the present world and in other worlds, it's clearly revealed and shown, always fully known, and the power of merit is most superior.

source_sentence: 「時福力王，為諸人眾廣說福事，開發心已，觀察虛空，作是念言：『快哉！
translation: The king of the power of merit then explained the meritorious things to the people in detail, developed his minds, observed space, and had this thought, saying, 'How wonderful!'

source_sentence: 我今可能徧於王城內外，悉雨種種珍寶衣服。』
translation: Now, I'll be able to rain down a variety of rare and precious clothing inside and outside the king's city.'

source_sentence: 發是心時，忽有種種殊妙衣服，及悅意華諸妙珍寶，自天而降，悉皆充滿王城內外。
translation: When he had this thought, a variety of exquisite clothing and beautiful jewels like joyous flowers suddenly descended down from heaven to fill the king's city, inside and out.

source_sentence: 現是相時，人天胥悅，咸生驚異，悉起廣大淨信之心，俱發是言：『快哉！
translation: At the time of these signs, everyone was delighted and all became frightened, aroused with vast pure faith, and they all said, 'How wonderful!'

source_sentence: 天子，有是福力，具大威德。』
translation: Son of god, this is the power of merit that's endowed with great authority and virtue.'

source_sentence: 「復次其後諸小國王，聞是事已，咸起思念：『彼王有大福力，具大名稱，
translation: “Furthermore, when the kings of the small countries who followed him heard these words, they all had this thought:

source_sentence: 我今宜應往彼尊奉。』
translation: Now, it's appropriate for me to go there and venerate him.'

source_sentence: 由是諸王共會一處，各領四兵，所謂象、馬、車、步兵眾，同詣福力王所，
translation: The kings assembled at one place and each led four divisions of the army: elephants, horses, chariots, and infantrymen. They all went to see King Pūrvavideha.

source_sentence: 下車前進，肅恭伸拜，合掌白言：『天子大福，具大名稱，為大國王，
translation: He dismounted from his carriage and advanced forward, paid respectful obeisance with veneration, joined his palms in salute, and said, “Dear prince of gods, you are endowed with great merit and renowned as the king of a great country.

source_sentence: 威德特尊，我等今時故來親奉。』
translation: Your majesty and virtue are especially honored, and we're here now to personally serve them.'

source_sentence: 「時福力王，即復致問，普為慰安，如次坐已，并其官屬，各與無價上妙珍寶；
translation: The king of the power of blessedness then again inquired and comforted them all. Having sat down one after the other, they were each given priceless rare treasures by their officials.

source_sentence: 又以十善法門，普為攝化。
translation: Also, the ten good aspects of the Dharma are universally collected and transformed.

source_sentence: 是時諸王，俱獲勝利，各還本國。
translation: The kings then gained victory and each returned to their own country.

source_sentence: 「復次，其後父眼力王，展轉聞知如是奇事，先遣使人詣彼國已，自當速疾與諸官屬，
translation: “Furthermore, when his father, the king of the eye powers, heard about such a marvelous thing in succession, he sent an envoy to that country and immediately reported it to the officials.

source_sentence: 終日竟夜，促途前進。
translation: Toward the end of the day and into the night they proceeded on their way.

source_sentence: 父王到已，愛念子故，即時遙見，雙目淚垂，悲喜交盈，聲哀心切，速從車下，
translation: When the father and king arrived, out of affection for their children, they immediately saw each other from a distance. Tears flowed down from their eyes in both directions, filling them with sorrow and joy. The sound was so grievous that they fled quickly to the bottom of the chariot.

source_sentence: 前執其手，久而視之，父王乃言：『我是汝父，汝必深知，我今年耄衰朽若斯，
translation: He held his hand in front of him for a long time and looked at him. His father, the king, said: I am your father. You must know well that this year I am as old and decrepit as you are.

source_sentence: 國政甚難，我不堪任，今付於汝，汝當負荷。』
translation: The national affairs are so difficult that I can't bear them. Now, I'll entrust them to you, and you will bear the burden.'

source_sentence: 言已即時卸自寶冠，置於子頂，子如父教，兼統其國。
translation: Immediately after saying this, he dismounted from his own jeweled crown and placed it on the prince’s head. The prince did as his father had taught him and governed the kingdom at the same time.

source_sentence: 佛說福力太子因緣經卷第三
translation: Foshuo foulli 太子因緣經卷第三佛說福力太子因緣經經經經,卷第三
